com.hr.expr.parser

Class Parser

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hr.expr.parser.Parser

  • public class Parser
extends java.lang.Object
    Parses strings representing mathematical formulas with variables. The following operators, in descending order of precedence, are defined:
    • ^ (raise to a power)
    • /
    • Unary minus (-x)
    • + -
    • < <= = <> >= >
    • and
    • or
    ^ associates right-to-left; other operators associate left-to-right.

    These unary functions are defined: abs, acos, asin, atan, ceil, cos, exp, floor, log, round, sin, sqrt, tan. Each requires one argument enclosed in parentheses.

    There are also binary functions: atan2, min, max; and a ternary conditional function: if(test, then, else).

    Whitespace outside identifiers is ignored.

    Examples:

    • 42
    • 2-3
    • cos(x^2) + sin(x^2)

    • Method Detail

      • parse

        public static Expr parse(java.lang.String input)
                  throws SyntaxException
        Return the expression denoted by the input string.
        Parameters:
        input - the unparsed expression
        Returns:
        The expression denoted by the input string.
        Throws:
        SyntaxException - if the input is unparsable

      • allow

        public void allow(Variable optVariable)
        Adjust the set of allowed variables: create it (if not yet existent) and add optVariable (if it's nonnull). If the allowed-variable set exists, the parser will reject input strings that use any other variables.
        Parameters:
        optVariable - the variable to be allowed, or null

      • parseString

                 throws SyntaxException
        Return the expression denoted by the input string.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

        Throws:
        SyntaxException - if the input is unparsable
